answers.answer: Hello.There could be two separate pathologies at the cervical and lumbar regions. A neurologist should search for any nerve/cord compression. Other causes of neuropathy should be ruled out, e.g. diabetes.Regards

question: My mom is having numbness and loss of pain and temperature sensation (not pressure) in her left ulnar nerve distribution area, along with decreased wrist flexion.  These symptoms alone have lasted 3-4 weeks, and within the last 2-3 weeks she has had the same symptoms along her S1 nerve root distribution of her left leg which is causing difficulty walking.  She is also experiencing "sharp, shooting" pain in this area on occasion.  With these symptoms being in the same distribution for the hand and foot and on the same side, what could she be looking at?  Is a neurologist the right specialist to see and what should they be looking for?Thank you,Samantha
title: Same sided neurological symptoms
